greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of domicule tilings of a k X n grid; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: A domicule is either a domino or it is formed by the union of two neighboring unit squares connected via their corners.  In a tiling the connections of two domicules are allowed to cross each other.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..36, flattened
example: |o o-o| |o o o| |o o o| |o o o| |o-o o|
|o o-o| |o o o| |o o o| |o o o| |o-o o|
|o o o o| |o o o-o| |o o-o o| |o o-o o| |o o-o o|
|o o o o| |o o o o| |o o o o| |o o o o| |o o o o|
|o-o o-o| |o-o o o| |o o-o o| |o-o o o| |o o-o o|
maple: b:= proc(n, l) option remember; local d, f, k;
else for k to d while not l[k] do od;
`if`(n>1 and l[k+d], b(n, subsop(k=f, k+d=f, l)), 0)+
`if`(k<d and l[k+1], b(n, subsop(k=f, k+1=f, l)), 0)
mathematica: b[n_, l_List] := b[n, l] = Module[{d = Length[l]/2, f = False, k}, Which [n == 0, 1, l[[1 ;; d]] == Array[f&, d], b[n-1, Join[l[[d+1 ;; 2*d]], Array[True&, d]]], True, For[k=1, !l[[k]], k++]; If[k<d && n>1 && l[[k+d+1]], b[n, ReplacePart[l, {k -> f, k+d+1 -> f}]], 0] + If[k>1 && n>1 && l[[k+d-1]], b[n, ReplacePart[l, {k -> f, k+d-1 -> f}]], 0] + If[n>1 && l[[k+d]], b[n, ReplacePart[l, {k -> f, k+d -> f}]], 0] + If[k<d && l[[k+1]], b[n, ReplacePart[l, {k -> f, k+1 -> f}]], 0]]]; A[n_, k_] := If[Mod[n*k, 2]>0, 0, If[k>n, A[k, n], b[n, Array[True&, k*2]]]]; Table[Table[A[n, d-n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 14}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 02 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Bisection of main diagonal gives: A239273.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 13 2014
